arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany unfazed by media criticism following Bayern Munich’s recent performances
arts.sum: Statistically, one could have the highest points per game on average and still receive heavy criticism, and even hear a few whispers calling for an early resignation. On average points per game, Kompany is the most successful manager in Bundesliga history, surpassing his own mentor and former coach, Pep Guardiola.

arts.ttl: Thomas Müller refutes Lothar Matthäus claim that Vincent Kompany humiliated him
arts.sum: But this season, he has settled on to the bench and accepted his backup role with little to no fuss, brilliantly pitching in whenever necessary, but also leading the side in its best and worst moments. Even though Müller has demonstrated his acceptance at his new role, others are less happy about it.

arts.ttl: Keep calm and carry on: Bayern Munich manager, Vincent Kompany, insists his side “stayed calm” amidst criticism, and will “stay calm” going forward
arts.sum: Bayern Munich have come under fire for some sub par performances in recent weeks, the attack in particular being criticised for its lack of imagination following goalless results against Bayer Leverkusen and Celtic Glagow. Bayern manager Vincent Kompany ensured fans that his side were always “calm” amidst the recent rocky run of form and plans for it to stay that way.

arts.ttl: The Next MLS Star? Jayden Nelson Matches Alphonso Davies' Record in Vancouver Whitecaps Debut
arts.sum: Jayden Nelson is now the first Canadian since Alphonso Davies to score a goal and three assists in an MLS match for the Vancouver Whitecaps.

arts.ttl: Thomas Müller lauds a “more fun” performance in Bayern Munich’s win over Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: After some difficult recent matches, such a convincing victory was, indeed, a lot of fun. But victories attained through great performances are much preferable.

arts.ttl: Bayern provide injury updates on Kimmich and Musiala
arts.sum: Bayern Munich have given updates on Joshua Kimmich and Jamal Musiala after both players were forced off against Eintracht Frankfurt.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show: Bayern Munich 4-0 Eintracht Frankfurt (Bundesliga)
arts.sum: Bayern Munich came away with a performance that had the Allianz Arena singing against a team that causes them problems regularly, Eintracht Frankfurt. Bayern Munich produced a performance to remember against Eintracht Frankfurt.

arts.ttl: Joshua Kimmich, Jamal Musiala both came off injured in Bayern Munich’s 4-0 win over Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Despite coming away with three points and a clean sheet to boost, there was cause for concern for Bayern due to both Joshua Kimmich and Jamal Musiala having to come off injured during the match. The win over Frankfurt came with a small toll for Bayen, as both Kimmich and Musiala came off injured.

arts.ttl: Observations from Bayern Munich’s 4-0 trouncing of Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Still, this was a match against an Eintracht Frankfurt side that has comfortably been the best team in the Bundesliga behind Leverkusen and Bayern. With 5 days to prepare for the Frankfurt game, there was no such excuse for Bayern and so this was the time to make their statement win.

arts.ttl: Kevin Trapp admits mistake yet feels Eintracht Frankfurt “played well” in Bayern Munich defeat
arts.sum: Eintracht Frankfurt keeper Kevin Trapp spoke on his goalkeeping error in following Sunday's league loss to FC Bayern München after the full-time whistle.
